Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Chitchat \Chit"chat\, n. [From {Chat}, by way of reduplication.] Familiar or trifling talk; prattle. [1913 Webster]

chitchat n : light informal conversation for social occasions [syn: {small talk}, {gab}, {gabfest}, {gossip}, {tittle-tattle}, {chin-wag}, {chin-wagging}, {causerie}] v : talk socially without exchanging too much information; "the men were sitting in the cafe and shooting the breeze" [syn: {chew the fat}, {shoot the breeze}, {chat}, {confabulate}, {confab}, {chatter}, {chaffer}, {natter}, {gossip}, {jaw}, {claver}, {visit}] [also: {chitchatting}, {chitchatted}]
